etymologies: late Middle English (originally as knopweed): from knop(because of its hard rounded involucre or ‘head’) + weed

definitions: a tough-stemmed Eurasian plant that typically has purple thistle-like flower heads, occurring chiefly in grassland and on roadsides.

notes.text: Genus Centaurea, family Compositae: several species, including the widespread black knapweed (C. nigra) (also called hardheads)
